definition: (bird species of China) mew gull (Larus canus)
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: A silver gull slips down from the west.
sentences.chinese: 一隻銀色的海鷗從西邊滑降。

sentences.english: The gulls went in slanting flight up the wind toward the gray desolate east.
sentences.chinese: 海鷗斜着翅膀迎着海風朝灰暗淒涼的東方飛去。

sentences.english: She could hear nothing but the waves and the seagulls flying up above in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 耳邊的海浪聲和海鷗掠過天空的聲音讓她陶醉。

sentences.english: The young gulls looked at him quizzically.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的海鷗們不解地望着他。

sentences.english: As I watched, a gull flew by, above the spruces.
sentences.chinese: 在我觀望的時候，一隻海鷗飛過雲杉。

sentences.english: A troop of seagulls slept on the water .
sentences.chinese: 一羣海鷗棲息在水面上。

sentences.english: Those seagulls suggest that land is not distant.
sentences.chinese: 看到那些海鷗便可知陸地在不遠處。

sentences.english: And The flung Spray and the blown spume, and the sea-gulls crying.
sentences.chinese: 還有翻滾的浪花，鼓脹的泡沫，以及海鷗的啼叫。

sentences.english: The next difficulty level entailed trying to catch the more clued -up, older gulls.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的一級難度是抓住見多識廣的老海鷗。

sentences.english: Often you hear high-pitched cries of the gulls as they search for food.
sentences.chinese: 你常常可以聽到正在捕食的海鷗發出尖厲的叫聲。

sentences.english: Why can't I see any seagulls here?
The wings of the sea gull were beating  frantically.
sentences.chinese: 海鷗的翅膀在瘋狂地撲扇着。

sentences.english: And in summer. One of its features is countless constantly screaming seagulls and independently looking at them proud black cormorants.
sentences.chinese: 而到了夏天，尖叫的海鷗和黑色的鸕鶿，隨處可見。

sentences.english: Experience the new gull-wing from Mercedes-Benz in an interactive tour.
sentences.chinese: 體驗全新的海鷗從奔馳翼互動之旅。

sentences.english: Seagulls swim well, but they do not often dive for fish .
sentences.chinese: 海鷗游泳非常棒，但他們不經常爲捕魚而遊。

sentences.english: A lone sea gull flew across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 一隻孤獨的海鷗在空中飛過。

definition: to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
to travel around/to roam/(mobile telephony) roaming
